availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Lisby. Signed a marriage bond to Sarah Heddy Lisby in Shelby County, Kentucky, on February 18, 1822. Father of Lewis Lisby, Elizabeth Lisby, Jane Lisby, Simon Lisby, Nancy Lisby, Henry Lisby, Howard Lisby, Washington Lisby, Mary Lisby. Farmer in Shelby County in 1850. Laborer in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 351B-352A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, p. 132.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Shelby County, Film # 000259283, February 18, 1822.
